Update Fe/Cru to 2.5.4.studio-6

fields.description:
Flowdock has written a new plugin for JIRA to bundled for the June release.  Plugin is [available here|http://dl.dropbox.com/u/2641544/flowdock-jira-plugin-1.0.2.jar].

Basic testing by KL team in progress, will update with results as they become available.
fields.summary: Bundle Flowdock Connector for JIRA

fields.description:
We would like to use the Numbered Headings plugin.

It appears to be the only way to formally number items for things like requirements documentation. E.g.

1.  this
  1.2.  that
      1.2.3  those

Here's the plugin: https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/16063

I entered this issue per these instructions: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/Third-Party+Plugin+Process
fields.summary: Numbered Headings plugin

fields.description: The header will only work with logos up to 34px tall. If the logo is too tall, scale it server-side to avoid bad ugly browser-based scaling and sending a large file to the client.
fields.summary: Scale logos to fit in header

fields.description: When using the tempo administration, the tempo admin menu is not opened by default and no admin item is selected
fields.summary: Create admin path mappings for tempo plugin
Update Tempo plugin to 6.1

fields.description: {{StudioNavbarInformationImpl}} is created with base URLs for Confluence and JIRA that are fetched from applinks. If the applink is changed (e.g. from http to https), the navbar is not updated with the new URLs, meaning a restart is required.
fields.summary: StudioNavbarInformationImpl caches base URLs

fields.description: The url for the Google icon on the button is hardcoded to http which causes mixed content warnings for https enabled instances.
fields.summary: Google icon on login page causes mixed content warning when https is enabled

fields.description: Not relevant, as Studio has no non-elastic agents.

Direct users to the bulk edit access level page at the end
Update Zeus image and improve its deployment script
Automated emails to support.atlassian.com are not processed
Handle attachments

fields.description:
Posted this already at https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-19369

I have had a number of my team ask me where to get the permalink to a Issue Navigator query is. I find myself pointing them to 'the oval looking icon in the top-right corner', which seems a lot harder than it needs to be... Given the amount of space available in that part of the UI, why hide the label?
fields.summary: Permalink to Issue Navigator query difficult to find

Pages cannot be edited in Confluence in IE9

fields.description:
1) Perform a Studio import as far as the "Rename Users" step.
2) Enter new names for the users on page 1.
3) Click "Rename Users" by mistake instead of page 2. (It's not clear whether you need to perform it separately for each page of users, especially due to AOD-4773)
4) Realise that it's about to start the import and press "Back" to finish renaming users.

fields.summary: Going back a step in the Studio importer throws an IllegalArgumentException

fields.description:
1) Get as far as the "rename users" step of the Studio Importer
2) Enter some names on the first page.
3) Switch to another page.

If you're using IE, you get a dirty form warning. This is kind of confusing, because it indicates that you need to save the names you've already typed before going to other pages, but there's no way to do that - apart from starting the actual import by mistake.

!ImportRenameDirtyForm.png!
fields.summary: Dirty form warnings in Studio Importer in IE

fields.description:
When using the JIRA import wizard, it tells admins to put the data into the "imports" directory on WebDav:

!ImportDirs1.png!

This directory doesn't actually exist:

!ImportDirs2.png!

If you create one and put the file into it, the importer doesn't pick it up. It only picks up files in the root directory.
fields.summary: Studio importer tells admins to upload the files to the wrong place

fields.description:
- Deployed Studio to my unicorn container via Maven.
- Login with admin account. Notice user name as "Administrator" on header dropdown.
- Created a project
- Go to Reviews tab

*Expected*: User name to be "Administrator"

*Actual*: User name is "Administrator Administrator"
fields.summary: Administrator name on FECRU appears as "Administrator Administrator"
Preserve svn permissions after svn import

fields.description:
After the May release we noticed some issues where applications would start up fine, but still be inaccessible via the web. This could have been caused by a number of things (e.g. AOD-4748) but there have been a number of cases where restarting Postgres along with the apps has been what 'fixed' it.

h3. Symptoms

- Unable to access the main applications (or they come up only after a long time) but can access Crowd OK.
- There are lots of {{httpd}} processes hanging around (e.g. 100+)
- One of either JIRA or Confluence will have hit Tomcat's max thread limit, e.g.
{noformat}
May 10, 2011 11:36:19 PM org.apache.tomcat.util.net.AprEndpoint createWorkerThread
INFO: Maximum number of threads (200) created for connector with address j2ee.instance.jirastudio.com-confluence/127.0.0.101 and port 8009
{noformat}
It's easy to confirm this by taking a thread dump. A typical thread dump might be 50-100K whilst one that hit its thread ceiling will be 800-900K.

Upon trying to shut the affected application down, log entries such as the following may be generated:
{noformat}
2011-05-11 04:37:03,548 ERROR [ContainerBackgroundProcessor[StandardEngine[Catalina]]] [sf.hibernate.util.JDBCExceptionReporter] logExceptions Cannot get a connection, general error
2011-05-11 04:37:03,821 ERROR [ContainerBackgroundProcessor[StandardEngine[Catalina]]] [ContainerBase.[Catalina].[localhost].[/wiki]] log Session event listener threw exception
org.springframework.transaction.CannotCreateTransactionException: Could not open Hibernate Session for transaction; nested exception is net.sf.hibernate.exception.GenericJDBCException: Cannot open connection
Caused by: net.sf.hibernate.exception.GenericJDBCException: Cannot open connection
      at net.sf.hibernate.exception.SQLStateConverter.handledNonSpecificException(SQLStateConverter.java:80)
      at net.sf.hibernate.exception.SQLStateConverter.convert(SQLStateConverter.java:69)
      at net.sf.hibernate.exception.JDBCExceptionHelper.convert(JDBCExceptionHelper.java:29)
      at net.sf.hibernate.impl.BatcherImpl.convert(BatcherImpl.java:328)
      at net.sf.hibernate.impl.BatcherImpl.openConnection(BatcherImpl.java:295)
      at net.sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl.connect(SessionImpl.java:3371)
      at net.sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl.connection(SessionImpl.java:3331)
      at org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTransactionManager.doBegin(HibernateTransactionManager.java:422)
      at org.springframework.transaction.support.AbstractPlatformTransactionManager.getTransaction(AbstractPlatformTransactionManager.java:350)

      at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:204)
      at $Proxy11.publishEvent(Unknown Source)
      at com.atlassian.confluence.user.listeners.UserSessionExpiryListener.sessionDestroyed(UserSessionExpiryListener.java:38)
      at org.apache.catalina.session.StandardSession.expire(StandardSession.java:702)

Caused by: org.apache.tomcat.dbcp.dbcp.SQLNestedException: Cannot get a connection, general error
      at org.apache.tomcat.dbcp.dbcp.PoolingDataSource.getConnection(PoolingDataSource.java:108)

      at org.apache.tomcat.dbcp.dbcp.PoolingDataSource.getConnection(PoolingDataSource.java:96)
      ... 23 more

However, the application may still not actually shut down without anything but a {{kill -9}}.

This leads me to believe that there could be problems with the database pool configuration in the applications, or in PostgreSQL's configuration. I've attached a thread dump while Confluence was in this deadlocked state.

Related? [https://sdog.jira.com/browse/JSTDEV-177] [https://sdog.jira.com/browse/JSTDEV-256] [https://sdog.jira.com/browse/JSTDEV-151]

{panel}
If anyone running IE8 is having trouble with GreenHopper in JIRA Studio, please apply the latest Windows Update patches to update IE8 to the latest bug-fix version.

We do not recommend using IE9 at this time, because it is not yet supported by any Atlassian application, and there are known issues in several areas of JIRA Studio.

If you still see new issues with the latest version of IE8, please create a new issue with the details of what you see.

If you are unable to update to the latest IE8, please leave a comment on this issue with details, and we can reconsider trying to find a workaround.

Thanks!

fields.description:
Currently, studio allows bamboo alone to be disabled through a config file or JVM property that is read into theme properties. In this case, bamboo doesn't start up at all.

Once 'a la carte' is in, the mechanism for disabling bamboo (and other applications) will be different, and the applications will still be running although they aren't accessible. Therefore, we should remove the themeProperties.isBambooEnabled property and replace with AppStatus based checks wherever appropriate.

I also think we should do away with the BAMLESS trunk build (and instead ensure that our functional tests adequately test all the cases with different combinations of enabled applications).
fields.summary: CLONE - Remove usage of themeProperties.isBambooEnabled check throughout the code and tests
CLONE - Remove a la carte enabled checks from the code and tests

fields.description:
The work done under AOD-4363 to remove the dark feature switch for à la carte will be reversed under AOD-4725, because we want to keep it dark in the June release.
After the June release, remove the dark feature switch again.
fields.summary: Remove à la carte dark feature switches again.

fields.description: A message appears to administrators in JIRA's UPM to explain that new plugin installation is not possible in Studio. The Confluence UPM should also contain the same instructions. However, see AOD-4734 for an issue with the contents of the message.
fields.summary: Studio UPM message only appears in JIRA UPM, not Confluence
Studio UPM message gives incorrect advice about requesting new plugins

fields.description:
I tried to change the default reviewer list to come just from the "default reviewers" field at https://studio.atlassian.com/secure/project/crucible/CrucibleProject!ViewProject.jspa?key=AJS

However it seems to have removed users from existing review https://studio.atlassian.com/source/cru/CR-AJS-353 (it had Sharkie on it originally, for example).

Anyway, permissions and setup seem screwy. 

What I need is:
* anyone with a studio account should be able to raise and participate in a review (we have to be able to accept patch reviews from external contributors)
* AUI team, or at least me, able to add/remove reviewers on any review in AJS
* ...I need someone to let me know why changing the reviewer setup made a few people drop off Hugh's review.
fields.summary: AUI project's review config is stuffed

fields.description: Not urgent since everyone is on same version, but should fix to remove confusion.
fields.summary: Need to coordinate version in footer to Affected and Fix versions.

fields.description:
The home page for a given project on StAC appears to be blank, whether I'm logged in or not.


ps: why is the version in the footer not a selectable version above? Somewhat confusing.
fields.summary: StAC JIRA Project home page is blank

fields.description:
The tooltip that appears if you hover next to the "Tempo" menu says "Alt+Shift+menu.accesskey.tempo_menu", instead of showing a real access key.

(I think this is a problem with the Tempo plugin rather than JIRA or Studio - filing it here anyway on Tim's advice.)
fields.summary: Tempo plugin menu has bad accesskey tooltip

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
 
 
*Original request description:*
Request to bundle Craftforge JQL plugin into Studio.

https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/31601
fields.summary: Bundle Craftforge JQL plugin

fields.description: Haup project uses webdriver 2.0.0-m23 while currently studio uses 2.0.0-m16. This causes trouble when trying to execute Haup functests under studio environment.
fields.summary: upgrade webdriver to 2.0.0-m23

fields.description:
This applies to IE7, and IE8 in compatibility mode (which Studio can automatically trigger).

On the Issues tab, the search field is missing from the new header:

!MissingSearchField1.png!

Where is it? FireBug wins the game of hide and seek:

!MissingSearchField2.png!
fields.summary: JIRA Quicksearch field is missing in IE7/IE8 (compatibility mode)

fields.description: A la carte was made non-dark under AOD-4363. We now intend to keep it dark for the June release, so the dark switch needs to be restored.
fields.summary: As a System Administrator, I want to make à la carte dark, so that the feature doesn't affect users before it is released.

fields.description:
Only happens when looking at the Confluence tab.

!HeaderMenusConfluence.png!

(Please note: IE8 compatibility mode is enabled and it seems to look OK without it.
I didn't do it manually - a page that Confluence served during the blitz yesterday automatically triggered Compatibility Mode for Studio. Not sure how many users will have Compatibility Mode enabled - they probably won't even notice if they do.)

Lots of fun here:
* The menus appear on top of, rather than beneath their headings.
* The Browse menu should be futher to the left.
* The Search field should be on the header, not below it.
* The Search field should not be overlapping the menu.

!HeaderMenusConfluence.png!
fields.summary: Confluence header menus are all over the place in IE7/IE8

fields.description:
The project dropdown should be in the top-left corner. In IE7 and IE8 it's in the top-right, which pushes the other menus out of the header and causes general unhappiness.

!ProjectMenuIE.png!
fields.summary: Project menu appears in the wrong place in the new header in IE and messes up the layout

fields.description:
In IE7 and IE8, the currently selected tab in the Studio header is not highlighted (highlit?). It's not very clear which application you are looking at.

e.g. Source tab should be highlighted:
!HeaderTabHighlight.png!
fields.summary: New header doesn't highlight active tab in IE7/IE8

fields.description:
To reproduce:

* browse to https://studio.atlassian.com/source/browse/TRUST
* click the search tab
* you get taken here: https://studio.atlassian.com/source/qsearch instead of here https://studio.atlassian.com/source/qsearch/TRUST

The Search bar in the header is also not project context aware.
fields.summary: Project Context is lost when clicking on the Source--> Search tab.

fields.description:
StAC hung after the upgrade. I've attached a thread dump and a trimmed down and sorted text file with the request processing threads.

It looks like there's a deadlock between threads that hold database connections that are waiting to lock either {{JiraCachingPropertySet}} or {{DefaultFieldLayoutManager}} and threads that hold locks that are blocked waiting for a DB connection.

I see a few problems here:

* Threads that are waiting for DB connections never time out, they just hang forever in this case.
* We don't seem to have configured either the DB pool or the thread pool in Tomcat. The defaults for these are totally out of whack.
* It's hard to tell which threads actually have DB connections, because of the broken resource acquisition pattern in use, but JIRA should probably be enforcing some kind of resource ordering here, for example by having methods that use internal locking and require a DB connection to require callers to provide the connection.
fields.summary: Deadlock due to connection pool exhaustion

fields.summary: Agile Tab goes to the wrong project (as in, not the current project)

fields.description:
(Eric Dalgliesh has already spent some time looking at this, just getting it into the system).

Repro steps:
1) Deploy a clean instance of Studio to Unicorn
2) Wait until everything has started up. In the case of FishEye, look for the message saying that the Licence has been installed.
(In one test, I left it overnight, just to be certain).
3) In the browser, navigate to the instance and log in as sysadmin.
Do *not* browse to the Source tab.
4) Create a new project. 

The project creation throws a 500 error due to a FishEye timeout.
This reproduces consistently on my instance (012) but not as consistently on others.  
If FishEye is visited first, or on subsequent project creations, it completes without error.

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}

fields.description:
Can not click on other groups on Safari and Chrome.
On Firefox is working, however the box to select another Group is not showing on the right place.

To reproduce:
1. Go to Agile tab on any project
2. Click on Issue id on card (i.e. SOP-69)
3. Click the "Comment" button at the bottom of the Jira.
4. Click on the drop down arrow next to "Viewable by All Users" under the comment box

Result:

fields.description:
A patch ({{common-choosetheme.vm.patch}}) was added to studio-confluence under AOD-4510 to provide a simple mechanism to display a warning when selecting a global or space-specific theme that does not display the studio header. Prior to this, a warning for space-specific theme selection was implemented using web panels. There are web panel no hooks for global theme selection.

The advantages of the patch are:
- The warning is in-page (as opposed to a click-through warning).
- The code is simple, and is shared for both global theme selection and space-specific theme selection.

One option would be to restore the web panel version for space-specific theme selection, and get hooks to do the same for global theme selection.
Given that the warning is polite but non-essential (the consequences of the theme selection are immediately visible and easily reversible), another option is to remove the warning altogether.

See also: https://studio.atlassian.com/source/cru/CR-AOD-514#c35746
fields.summary: Remove patch for theme selection warning in Confluence.

fields.description:
This concerns TestConfluencePlugins.testStudioPluginsAreEnabledAndCannotBeDisabled and TestConfluencePlugins.testStudioConfluenceStandalonePluginIsDisabledAndCannotBeEnabled.

For studio-confluence-common-plugin and studio-confluence-standalone-plugin, pluginJson.getBoolean('optional') returns true causing the above-mentioned tests to fail.

For studio-theme-confluence-plugin, pluginJson.getBoolean('optional') returns false (the value that is asserted). 

I don't understand what exactly this is trying to test, and why studio-theme-confluence-plugin returns a different 'optional' value to studio-confluence-common-plugin and studio-confluence-standalone-plugin.

Currently, I've commented out the code that causes tests to fail in TestConfluencePlugins.
fields.summary: Don't understand 'optional' flag returned by upm client that is causing confluence standalone related tests to fail in TestConfluencePlugins
Pass confluence standalone flag to crowd so that crowd creates the appropriate groups based on whether we are in standalone or studio mode

fields.description:
In Confluence, the "Keyboard Shortcuts" menu item in the "Browse" drop-down menu cannot be selected. Whenever the mouse pointer slides over it, the whole drop-down menu retracts. Please see the attached screen video for details. ([^menu.swf])

It seems that an unordered list right beneath the drop-down menu causes this problem. (Thanks to Penny for finding out this.) If we deleted that "{{ul}}" element from the DOM, the problem goes away.
